meanings.definition: Material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances.
meanings.sent1: I used colorful paper to make a birthday card for my friend.
meanings.sent2: She wrote her name on a piece of paper and handed it to the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The paper airplane I made didn't fly very far.
meanings.sent4: His words were as light as a paper in the wind, easily forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The delicate paper cranes danced in the breeze, a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A piece of paper with writing or printing on it.
meanings.sent1: I found a crumpled paper with a phone number written on it.
meanings.sent2: The important information was printed on the paper handed to me.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled his drink on the paper, smudging the ink.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like ink on paper, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The paper with the treasure map led us on an exciting adventure.

meanings.sent1: Every morning, he reads the paper with his breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The paper reported on the latest events in the city.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the paper, causing a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The headlines on the paper screamed of a looming storm.
meanings.sent5: She enjoyed the crossword puzzle in the paper, challenging her mind.

meanings.definition: A document or piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: He carefully filed away the legal paper for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The paper contained all the details of the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The dog chewed on the paper, leaving teeth marks on the edges.
meanings.sent4: Her paper on climate change was praised for its thorough research.
meanings.sent5: The ancient paper revealed secrets of a long-forgotten civilization.
